intro: Crotalaria lanceolata subsp. contigua, commonly known as the narrowleaf crotalaria, is a herbaceous annual plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves with a lanceolate shape. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in racemose inflorescences, and are accompanied by stipules. This species is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
